title: Real Madrid to sell Brahim Diaz less than a YEAR after signing him from Manchester City for £22m
text:
Real Madrid are making plans to move out the deadwood in their ranks and have informed fringe players that they are free to leave the club in pursuit of first-team football.

Among the stars who the Spanish giants wish to offload in January include Brahim Diaz who was signed from Manchester City in a deal worth £22million less than a year ago.

Diaz's time at the club was hampered in the summer by a hamstring injury but upon recovering does not appear to be part of Zinedine Zidane's plans, with the club informing him that he is free to leave according to AS.

Brahim Diaz has made just 12 Real Madrid appearances since joining from Manchester City

Since his move to the Bernabeu he has featured in just 12 games across all competitions and just once this season - coming on in the final eight minutes during the weekend's defeat at Real Mallorca.

The 20-year-old's time in Spain has resulted in him scoring just once and assisting two goals.

He had appeared more in the back end of the previous campaign but his fall down the pecking order suggests he is surplus to requirements at the club.

This could be further compounded in January with Madrid weighing up a potential swoops for Tottenham's wantaway star Christian Eriksen and Ajax starlet Donny van de Beek.

Diaz has in the last year changed his agent, with his father now representing him and it is still not certain whether he will elect to leave the club in January to pursue his career and development elsewhere.
description: Real Madrid are making plans to move out the deadwood in their ranks and have informed fringe players that they are free to leave the club in pursuit of first-team football.
